intro: Paranotis mitrasacmoides subsp. trachymenoides, commonly known as the Trachymenoides thyme, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants known for their fragrant leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of purple or pink flowers. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
